Others: DJ Herz, a former Cubs prospect, faced his old organization for the first time as a starting pitcher for the Nationals.
Herz pitched 4 2/3 innings, allowing 3 hits, 2 walks, and 5 strikeouts, with all four runs scored in his final inning.
Herz was selected by the Cubs in the 8th round of the 2019 Draft and was named their Minor League Pitcher of the Year in 2021.
Herz was traded to the Nationals in July 2023 and added to their 40-man roster last fall.
Herz began the 2024 season in Triple-A and earned his Major League callup on June 4.
Herz opened the game by striking out Ian Happ with a 96.5 mph fastball and retired the side on 11 pitches in the first inning.
Herz faced familiar faces on both sides of the field, including Pete Crow-Armstrong, who he went through the system with.
Herz's next series against the Cubs will be in Chicago during their final road trip of the season, Sept. 19-22.
